problem_text: Use the Trapezoidal Rule with $n=5$ to approximate the integral $\int_1^2(1 / x) d x$.
solution:
With $n=5, a=1$, and $b=2$, we have $\Delta x=(2-1) / 5=0.2$, and so the Trapezoidal Rule gives
$$
\begin{aligned}
\int_1^2 \frac{1}{x} d x & \approx T_5=\frac{0.2}{2}[f(1)+2 f(1.2)+2 f(1.4)+2 f(1.6)+2 f(1.8)+f(2)] \\
& =0.1\left(\frac{1}{1}+\frac{2}{1.2}+\frac{2}{1.4}+\frac{2}{1.6}+\frac{2}{1.8}+\frac{1}{2}\right) \\
& \approx 0.695635
\end{aligned}
$$

This approximation is illustrated in Figure 3.
